cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles (145 km) southeast of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the northern Yucatán today, then turning north and accelerating north-northeast across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast on Wednesday; the remnant circulation is forecast to sweep northeastward across the Southeast U.S. and reach the Mid-Atlantic (including Virginia) late Thursday night into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches limited to the northern Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City, LA, to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings only for the Yucatán Peninsula (Tulum-Dzilam) at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast (LA-AL) Wednesday, then inland through MS-AL-GA and into the Carolinas and Virginia by Thursday night/Friday
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated pockets up to 6 inches forecast for parts of VA)
weather_observation.wind: Low (12%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds; brief gusts possible late Thu-Fri as the storm’s remnants pass.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast because the cyclone will be an inland remnant low by the time it reaches the Mid-Atlantic.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain 2–4 in., isolated 4–6 in., could cause flash-urban flooding and swollen small rivers Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief spin-up tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands Thursday night–Friday; reduced visibilities and temporary port-channel closures from heavy rain.
